unnormalised: Namaste readers! The renewable energy sector in India is buzzing. A new report from IIT-Delhi suggests solar power adoption is soaring, especially in rural Rajasthan. Dr. Sharma, lead author, says costs have plummeted making it a viable option even for smaller villages.
normalised: Namaste readers! The renewable energy sector in India is buzzing. A new report from I I T-Delhi suggests solar power adoption is soaring, especially in rural Rajasthan. Doctor Sharma, lead author, says costs have plummeted making it a viable option even for smaller villages.

unnormalised: This comes as the Maharashtra government announces a new wind energy project near Nashik, expected to power over 50,000 homes. It aims to reduce the state's reliance on coal by 15% within 5 years.
normalised: This comes as the Maharashtra government announces a new wind energy project near Nashik, expected to power over fifty thousand homes. It aims to reduce the state's reliance on coal by fifteen percent within five years.

unnormalised: Meanwhile, a pilot project in Kerala is exploring the use of tidal energy. Preliminary findings show potential to generate significant power using eco-friendly methods. Farmers are also benefiting, with solar-powered irrigation pumps saving them Rs. 20,000 annually on electricity bills on average. Some are even converting unused land into solar farms, earning extra income. This sustainable shift is also creating new jobs in manufacturing and maintenance, covering everything from large installations to rooftop systems on just 500 sq ft.
normalised: Meanwhile, a pilot project in Kerala is exploring the use of tidal energy. Preliminary findings show potential to generate significant power using eco-friendly methods. Farmers are also benefiting, with solar-powered irrigation pumps saving them rupee twenty thousand annually on electricity bills on average. Some are even converting unused land into solar farms, earning extra income. This sustainable shift is also creating new jobs in manufacturing and maintenance, covering everything from large installations to rooftop systems on just five hundred square feet.
